intro: Borreria verbenoides f. cuarta, commonly known as the Mexican verbena, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
